intro: Pentaloncha stipulosa, commonly known as the stipulate pentaloncha, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and features palmate leaves with distinct stipules. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and ecological role in its native habitat.
